name: Marriott Park City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the property. Although it wasn't awful, it wasn't ideal either. I expected a lot more from a category 5 Marriott property. We had requested a room on an upper floor away from the lobby and elevator area, but we got a 2nd floor room very close to a ballroom type area where a high school reunion was going on. Additionally, the climate control unit in the room was excessively loud and clicked on and off at random waking us up all night long. Our room overlooked a courtyard where there was a tent set up, luckily there were no events in there as I would assume that they would have been very loud. Other patrons were complaining about noise from the bar area.
reviews.title: I'd probably stay elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was very nice and the bed was comfortable. Nothing special to note about the bathroom. The front desk service was only ok, they frequently were unable to answer any questions. The property is quite a bit away from Main Street and downtown Park City, so be prepared for a longish ride on the bus, if you don't want to drive down.
reviews.title: Fine stay at Marriott in August

likes.liked: — It's just a good, clean and fine hotel for the price with a fine location and atmosphere
likes.disliked: — That breakfast on the concierge floor ended at 9:00am

reviews.text: The lobby was fairly heavily scented with a piney smell, but this didn't carry through to the rooms, thank goodness.
reviews.title: Does Marriott Know What's Going On Here?

likes.liked: — It was within walking distance of several Sundance venues, once the buses stopped.
likes.disliked: — The absolute incompetence of the staff and their inability to make things right.

reviews.text: The breakfast buffett was ok as well. The food was overall pretty good at this property and the bar has a fairly lively night scene.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the price

reviews.text: The gym was pretty nice and clean with plenty of machines.
reviews.title: Nice Stay here!

likes.liked: — The little extras included, comfortable stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the Christmas holiday for 5 nights. We can't say enough about our wonderful experience at this hotel. As you first walk into the lobby, you are greeted by a sparkling two-story Christmas tree and glowing fireplace. The staff was extraordinarily friendly and helpful. We absolutely loved our stay. Don't be fooled by the online pics on the Marriott website - this place is charming and cozy. Exactly what you would want for a ski destination. On Christmas Eve, the attentive staff even left a small goodie bag with homemade chocolate chip cookies and 2 candy canes. Room was clean and what you would expect from a Marriott. It is a little off the beaten track from Park City's Main Street and skiiing resorts - but there are free transportation options to get you to where you need to go. There's a complimentary shuttle that runs you up to either Park City Mountain Resort or Deer Valley. The city bus stop is right outside the hotel. Breakfast buffet for $11.95 included OJ or coffee, made to order waffles and fantastic omelets. Also, guests can check out games (we chose a brand new version of Monopoly). Similarily, we saw other guests playing games in the lobby. Overall, the pleasant ambiance will definitely bring us back when we visit Park City again.
reviews.title: Little touches made the difference. Fantastic stay!!!!

likes.disliked: — Location is not on Main Street

reviews.text: My husband and I went for a business trip and stayed an extra night and booked at the Marriott. The rate was very good.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: The rooms was very nice and newly remodeled. They had a 15% discount at the restaurant but we did not eat there.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: The room was cherry and clean. Bedding was nice. The room was big and overlooked the indoor pool/jacuzzi which looked very nice. They charge to use the business center and there was no comp breakfast. Patty at the desk was very nice and helpful...everyone was friendly. WE would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Excellent Staff

likes.liked: — The staff was very accomodating and went out of their way to be helpful.
likes.disliked: — Room was a little noisy and the curtains did not close.

reviews.title: Very nice hotel.
reviews.text: We were on the 3rd floor (of 4 floors) and most every room was being remodeled however it was quiet. The parking was tight as it is an older facility more downtown area...close to restaurants and shops. Fun Visit.

My stay at the Marriott Park City in Park City, UT could have been better and didnt quite live up to expectations for a hotel of this level in ski country. The hotel is located about a mile (2 km) from downtown Park City and just a ten minute drive to the three ski areas surrounding Park City. It's surrounded on all sides by city streets, literally just a sidewalk away. This was a problem with loud traffic throughout the day. One evening after a few days of heavy snow, the city snow plows decided to widen the street by moving back the snow banks on the street outside our window until past midnight....quite loud!! The desk staff were always very friendly and helpful in answering any questions about the area. The room was your typical hotel room, nothing fancy. It had a small refrigerator but no microwave oven. The beds were very comfortable with feather pillows and a down duvet. The hotel cleaning staff is your typical "south of the border" cleaning staff with poor communications skills. They left dirty silverware in our room for three days and occasionally left dirty towels as well if they weren't specifically thrown on the floor. The internet service in the hotel room was intermittent at best for the entire weeklong stay and we were told more than once that a technician was looking into the problem...with no real resolution to the problem. The hotel has a nice indoor pool and a small jacuzzi that holds maybe 6-8 people. Towels were not always stocked around the jacuzzi area like they should have been. Parking at the hotel was free. All in all, not a bad stay, but there has to be better in Park City for the $350 + per night range.
reviews.title: Okay, but better options available.

reviews.text: Our Chicago-based group (100+) was split between two hotel properties. Sundance was just wrapping-up when we arrived, and there was a ton of activity in this property which served as the HQ for the festival. Our early arrival was accommodated by staff who secured our baggage and populated it as our rooms were readied while we skied.
reviews.title: Ours was a large group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transportation was provided to Park City mountain(s) by Marriott shuttle during specific hours; a free bus system operates longer hours, but is not as direct. While only a mile or so to the Main Street area, there are no sidewalks upon which to stroll downtown.
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff and Nice Accomidations

likes.disliked: — The bathroom left a little bit to be desired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We benefited from outstanding staff in most departments, save the restaurant. While the people were friendly enough, service was a taffy pull.
reviews.title: Good stay at the Marriott; great service!
Terrible reservation policy---DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here during Sundance 2008. It was the festival headquarters and was absolutely bustling with activity. The room was very nice, with robes, flat screen tv, marble counters, second sink outside bathroom, fridge, bottled water, and Bath & Body Works products. The beds had feather pillows and synthetic pillows and fluffy duvets and the mattress weren't as soft as my Euro pillow top at home, but not bad. We had issues with my medical equipment and the Marriott staff helped us tremendously. We stayed on the Concierge level and had access to the concierge lounge, which had wifi, breakfast, appetizers, and dessert. We also were treated to a bottle of wine and a wheel of brie. We order room service, which was good and fast. We ate at the hotel restaurant, which we were not really impressed with. Would definately stay here again. Room price was around $280/night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives......concierge level club room is a major disappointment.
reviews.title: The staff are its best feature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast is terrible,is way too small .
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

likes.disliked: — Concierge level services weren't that spectacular

reviews.text: rooms can overlook indoor pool and atrium which makes them noisy and not very nice as you only look at other rooms.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Marriott Park City

likes.liked: — room was comfy and no mildew smell
likes.disliked: — the hotel shampoo, rinse, and body lotion.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the main bar is average as is the main restaurant
reviews.title: Nice Hotel But.....

likes.disliked: — The thin walls and the kids running up and down the halls

reviews.text: location requires car to access ski fields or shopping at Redstone or dining out although there are some restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Good Experience

aka: Marriott Park City Hotel Park City
description: Embark on an unforgettable adventure at the Park City Marriott. The Marriott Park City is the landmark choice of Park City, Utah hotels, offering majestic views of the surrounding Wasatch Mountains and world-class comfort in the heart of ski country. Experience the area’s rich recreation by day, then retreat to the warmth and convenience of full-service luxury. With its luxurious guestrooms, savory restaurant, and relaxing atrium-style pool, this three-star Park City hotel provides exceptional comfort in a picturesque setting.
